title: How to Make Lighter Sugar Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (176.6 C).
steps.description: Before you start preparing the dough for these low-calorie sugar cookies, first turn your oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (176.6 C). Also prepare a large baking sheet by greasing it with a stick of butter or by spraying it with cooking spray. To grease the pan, wipe the bottom of the pan with the end of a stick of butter.

steps.headline: Combine the butter, sugar and oil.
steps.description: In a large mixing bowl, add the butter, sugar and oil. Use a fork to mash the sugar into the softened butter, then use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients together into a wet, creamy mixture.

steps.headline: Beat in the egg, vanilla, salt and baking powder.
steps.description: After you have combined the butter, sugar and oil, crack the egg into the mixing bowl. Use a whisk or spoon to vigorously mix the egg into the dough until it is well incorporated. Then mix in the vanilla, salt and baking powder.

steps.headline: Add in the flour gradually.
steps.description: Once all the wet ingredients are combined, pour the flour into a measuring cup. Start to add the flour by the ½ cup (118.29 ml), stirring the flour in after each addition. Keep adding flour and stirring until you have added all the flour and the dough is homogenous.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (176 C).
steps.description: Another way to make healthier sugar cookies is to replace the wheat flour with almond flour and to use vegan ingredients like coconut oil and agave nectar. To begin making these sugar cookies, turn the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (176 C), and grease a cooking sheet with butter or a butter alternative. These gluten-free cookies are also vegan and paleo, so they are suitable for many kinds of diets.

steps.headline: Blend the ingredients in a food processor.
steps.description: Once you have preheated the oven, pour the five ingredients into a food processor and blend them on a medium setting until the dough is smooth and the coconut oil has melted and blended with the other ingredients. If you don’t have a food processor, first melt the coconut oil in a double broiler. Then combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl and mix vigorously by hand until you have formed a dough. To melt the coconut oil in a double broiler, place an inch (2.54 cm) of water in the bottom of a double broiler, then place the coconut oil in the top pan of the double broiler. Put the double broiler on the stove over medium heat and stir the coconut oil until it has melted.

steps.headline: Wrap the dough in saran wrap and form it into a ball.
steps.description: After you have combined the ingredients into a dough, spread a large sheet of plastic wrap on the counter. Scoop the dough on top of the sheet of plastic wrap, then fold up the corners of the plastic wrap to completely wrap the dough. Work the plastic wrap covered dough, squeezing it into a ball shape with your hands.

steps.headline: Place the dough in the refrigerator for ten minutes.
steps.description: After you have covered the dough in plastic wrap and have formed it into a ball, place the ball of dough in the fridge for ten minutes. Chilling the dough makes it smoother and easier to work with.

methods.name: Shaping and Baking the Sugar Cookies

steps.headline: Roll the dough.
steps.description: Once you have made either your low-calorie or vegan dough, it’s time to shape the cookies. Begin by spreading a thin layer of flour over a clean counter or cutting board. Then place the dough on top of the floured surface. Use a rolling pin to roll the dough until the sheet of dough is about ¼ inch thick (0.6 cm.) If you are making the gluten-free cookies, use almond flour to flour your surface. You need to roll your dough if you are using cookie cutters to cut out your sugar cookies. If you are just making round sugar cookies, don’t roll out the dough. Instead, roll the dough into small balls with a diameter of about 1 inch (2.54 cm.)

steps.headline: Cut out your cookies and place them on the baking sheet.
steps.description: After you have rolled out your dough, use cookie cutters to cut out your sugar cookies. Then place the cut-outs on the baking sheet, separated by about 1 inch (2.54 cm) of space. If you have scraps left over, form them into a ball, roll them out, and cut out more cookies. If you are not using cookie cutters, place the balls of dough that you made on the greased baking sheet. Then dip the bottom of a regular drinking glass in flour or sugar and press on each ball to flatten it to about ¼ inch (0.6 cm) in thickness.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Place the pan of cookies in the preheated oven and bake them for 7-10 minutes. The low-calorie sugar cookies will likely need the full ten minutes, whereas the gluten-free cookies may only need 7 or 8. Keep an eye on the cookies and take them out of the oven when they are golden-brown.

steps.headline: Cool and serve the cookies.
steps.description: After you take the cookies out of the oven, remove them from the pan using a spatula and place them on a cooling rack. If you don’t have a cooling rack, place them on a plate or clean counter. After about ten minutes of cooling, serve and enjoy your sugar cookies!
